item.title: 干旱笼罩美国东北部，纽约市引发秋季野火恐慌
item.description: 随着夏末干旱席卷美国东北部，新英格兰部分地区的水道和水井正在干涸，纽约市的树木已经开始落叶，野火的风险也随之上升。【原文：Waterways and wells are running dry in parts of New England and trees in New York City are already shedding their leaves as a late-summer drought engulfs the US Northeast, raising the risk of wildfires.】

item.title: 《布隆伯格绿色》纽约气候周指南
item.description:
从各国新的气候承诺到卡拉OK之夜，这些都是不可错过的活动。【原文：

From countries’ new climate pledges to karaoke night, these are the must-catch events.

】

item.title: 各国批准首个保护海洋生物的全球条约
item.description:
新协议允许设立海洋保护区，并规定对可能破坏生物多样性的活动进行环境审查。【原文：

The new agreement allows for marine protection areas and mandates environmental review of activities that could damage biodiversity.

】

item.title: 太阳能制造商因金属价格飙升而放弃使用白银
item.description: 全球太阳能制造商是白银的最大工业消费者，在白银价格飙升的背景下，他们将在数年内首次减少贵金属的使用量。【原文：Global solar manufacturers, the largest industrial consumers of silver, are set to reduce use of the precious metal for the first time in years amid a scorching rally in its price.】

item.title: 特朗普正在以危险的速度瓦解气候科学
item.description: 白宫阻止了测量、应对和抗击全球变暖的努力。这将所有美国人置于危险之中。【原文：La Casa Blanca ha bloqueado los esfuerzos para medir, responder y combatir el calentamiento global. Eso pone en riesgo a todos los estadounidenses.】

item.title: 托运人警告净零计划到 2035 年可能耗资超过 3000 亿美元
item.description: 一些航运公司警告说，国际海事组织计划制定的净零规则有可能给航运业带来巨大成本。【原文：A group of shipping firms warned that the International Maritime Organization’s planned net zero rules risk imposing significant costs on the industry.】

item.title: 中国两大太阳能巨头结束法律之争，行业陷入困境
item.description: 隆基绿色能源科技股份有限公司（LONGI Green Energy Technology Co.【原文：LONGi Green Energy Technology Co. and Jinko Solar Co. have agreed to settle their patent lawsuits to help promote growth in an industry that has struggled with overcapacity and deep losses.】

item.title: 汽车制造商转向电动皮卡，尝试重新定义 "经济型 "皮卡
item.description: 去年美国最畅销的汽车是皮卡。第二名呢？也是皮卡。(记分的话，它们分别是福特 F 系列和 GMC Sierra）。【原文：The top-selling vehicle in the US last year was a pickup. Second place? Also a pickup. (They were the Ford F-Series and GMC Sierra respectively, for those keeping score.)】

item.title: Gresham House 在绿色基础设施交易中收购 SUSI Partners
item.description: 英国资产管理公司 Gresham House 同意收购总部位于瑞士的 SUSI Partners，作为拓展与能源转型相关的基础设施市场战略的一部分。【原文：UK asset manager Gresham House agreed to buy Switzerland-based SUSI Partners as part of a strategy to expand in the market for infrastructure tied to the energy transition.】

item.title: 小米将为约 40% 的 SU7 电动汽车部署辅助驾驶修复系统
item.description: 小米公司（Xiaomi Corp. ）将部署一个空中软件修复程序，以纠正其先进驾驶辅助技术的问题，该技术已安装在其销售的近 40% 的 SU7 电动轿车上。【原文：Xiaomi Corp. will deploy an over-the-air software fix to rectify a problem in its advanced driver assistance technology installed in almost 40% of the SU7 electric sedans it’s sold.】

item.title: 欧洲电动汽车制造商在爱沙尼亚稀土磁铁工厂排队等候
item.description: 欧洲电动汽车行业的高管们正跋山涉水来到欧洲大陆人口稀少的东北部地区，排队购买他们在中国以外的任何地方都很难找到的东西：电动汽车的重要部件稀土磁铁。【原文：Executives from Europe’s electric-vehicle industry are trekking to the continent’s sparsely populated northeastern parts to queue for something they struggle to find anywhere outside of China: rare-earths magnets that are essential components in EVs.】

item.title: 竞争对手觊觎金属，新加坡寻求非洲碳信用额度
item.description: 中国、印度和美国都想要非洲的重要矿产。新加坡的主要目标则不同：非洲大陆的碳抵消。【原文：China, India and the US want Africa’s critical minerals. Singapore’s main target is different: the continent’s carbon offsets.】

item.title: BNEF 未来之桶峰会的五大收获
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统、人工智能的崛起和全球电气化等几股关键力量迫使各能源领域的公司调整其可持续发展目标和投资重点。【原文：A few key forces — President Donald Trump, the rise of artificial intelligence and global electrification — have compelled companies across the energy spectrum to adjust their sustainability goals and investment priorities.】

item.title: 特朗普政府寻求审查另一座海上风电场
item.description: 特朗普政府要求联邦法院推翻政府对马萨诸塞州附近一个大型海上风电场的批准，将其退回内政部进一步审查，这标志着对可再生能源资源的又一次打击。【原文：The Trump administration asked a federal court to upend the government’s approval of a massive offshore wind farm near Massachusetts by sending it back to the Interior Department for further review, marking another blow against the renewable energy resource.】

item.title: 氧气公司高管称直接空气捕集模式现在无法获得银行支持
item.description: 美国西方石油公司（Occidental Petroleum Corp.【原文：Startups developing direct air projects will need to look beyond traditional financing models to scale the technology, according to the president of Occidental Petroleum Corp.’s carbon removal unit.】

item.title: 气候斗争仍在继续，欧盟带着最低标准前往纽约
item.description: 欧盟领导人下周将出席在纽约举行的联合国大会，但他们再次未能按时完成气候方面的功课。【原文：European Union leaders will turn up at the United Nations General Assembly in New York next week having failed again to deliver their climate homework on time.】

item.title: 野火烟雾将造成越来越多的死亡和经济损失
item.description:
一项新的研究显示，随着气候变暖，与颗粒物有关的早产死亡人数将不断增加

。【原文：

Premature deaths linked to particulate matter will keep increasing as the climate warms, according to a new study

】

item.title: 联邦紧急事务管理局内部一片混乱，死亡威胁分散了飓风应对工作的注意力
item.description:
内部文件显示，在去年接连发生的飓风中，网络阴谋和人身攻击如何扰乱了联邦紧急事务管理局的工作。【原文：

Internal documents show how online conspiracies and personal attacks disrupted FEMA during back-to-back hurricanes last year.

】

item.title: 埃克森首席执行官警告欧盟气候和人权法 "伤筋动骨
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp. ）呼吁欧洲领导人废除一项新的气候和人权法律，该法律将对企业处以罚款，并有可能成为美欧贸易谈判的热点。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. called for European leaders to repeal a new climate and human rights law that would fine corporations and is threatening to become a flashpoint in US-EU trade negotiations.】

item.title: 欧盟出资 13 亿欧元支持纳米比亚的绿色事业
item.description: 欧洲联盟承诺提供 13 亿欧元（15 亿美元）的一揽子资金，支持纳米比亚的清洁能源计划和关键材料的本地加工。【原文：The European Union pledged a €1.3 billion package ($1.5 billion) to support Namibia’s clean energy plans and the local processing of critical materials.】

item.title: 全球银行对能源转型的融资停滞不前
item.description: 去年，全球银行业在为清洁能源转型提供资金方面未能取得任何进展，用于石油、天然气和煤炭的资金继续超过用于可再生能源的资金。【原文：The global banking sector failed to make any progress in financing the clean energy transition last year, with capital allocations to oil, gas and coal continuing to outpace money spent on renewables.】

item.title: 喷气流转变带来寒冷，欧洲气温将出现波动
item.description: 据预测，本周末喷射气流的变化将推动西欧气温迅速由暖转凉。【原文：A shift in the jet stream is forecast to drive a rapid swing from warm to cool temperatures across western Europe toward the end of this week.】

item.title: 预报员预测将有超强台风来袭，香港要做好应对双重风暴的准备
item.description: 由于两个风暴在温暖的热带海域酝酿，其中一个系统预计将在下周加强为超强台风，香港将面临一段暴雨和强风期。【原文：Hong Kong is facing a period of heavy rain and strong winds as two storms brew in warm tropical waters, with one system forecast to intensify into a super typhoon next week.】

item.title: 2024 年全球水循环 "反复无常"，导致洪水和干旱
item.description: 联合国气象机构在一份新报告中说，全球供水的可靠性正在降低，导致危险的洪水、干旱，并对农业造成威胁。【原文：Global water supplies are becoming less reliable, leading to dangerous floods, droughts and threats to agriculture, the United Nation’s weather agency said in a new report.】

item.title: 为石油的终结建造纪念碑
item.description:
科威特艺术家莫尼拉-卡迪里（Monira Al Qadiri）在 "零 "播客中说："我在一个没有石油就无法生存的国家里创作关于石油终结的艺术

。【原文：

“I'm making art about the end of oil in a country that would not be able to survive without it,” says Kuwaiti artist Monira Al Qadiri on the Zero podcast

】

item.title: 化石燃料巨头澳大利亚力争到 2035 年减排 62
item.description: 作为世界上最大的化石燃料出口国之一，澳大利亚承诺到2035年将温室气体排放量削减62%至70%，以兑现加快气候行动的承诺。【原文：Australia pledged to cut greenhouse gas emissions within a range of 62% to 70% by 2035, as one of the world’s largest fossil fuel exporters aims to deliver on pledges to accelerate climate action.】

item.title: 调查发现，企业低估了更广泛的气候风险
item.description: 许多企业甚至在亲身经历了更极端天气的影响之后，仍然忽视了其气候风险的全部程度。【原文：Many businesses are overlooking the full extent of their climate risk, even after they’ve experienced the impacts of more extreme weather first-hand.】

item.title: 埃克森公司因欧盟规定停止 1 亿欧元回收投资
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp.）正在欧洲搁置对化学品回收的投资，原因是该能源巨头认为欧洲对塑料的限制过于严格。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. is shelving investments in chemical recycling in Europe due to what the energy giant says are overly restrictive rules on plastics.】

item.title: 美国科学小组称温室气体危害 "无可争议
item.description:
美国国家科学院肯定了所谓 "濒危结论 "背后的科学依据，特朗普政府希望撤销这一结论。【原文：

The National Academies affirmed the science behind the so-called endangerment finding, which the Trump administration hopes to revoke.

】

item.title: 巴西称 79 个代表团已为 COP30 筹备好住宿
item.description: 巴西政府周三表示，距离第三十届缔约方大会召开还有不到两个月的时间，已有 79 个代表团确认将在亚马逊城市贝伦（Belem）住宿，参加联合国气候峰会。【原文：With less than two months until COP30, 79 delegations have confirmed lodging in the Amazonian city of Belem for the United Nations climate summit, Brazil’s government said Wednesday.】
